AIRTIME.Definition: (the amount of) broadcasting time that someone or something has on television or radio

AN INSIDE JOB.Definition: a crime, especially stealing, committed by someone in the organisation in which they work

ASSUME.Definition: to accept something to be true without question or proof

ATTRIBUTE.Definition: a quality or characteristic that someone or something has

BADDIES.Definition: people, especially in a film or story, who are bad

BLOCKS.Definition: a solid, straight-sided piece of hard material

CHILD SEX RING.Definition: a group relating to the abuse of children

CRYOGENICALLY.Definition: ‚Äçif you are cryogenically frozen, you are frozen after death, with a view to being brought back to life

DEBUNKED.Definition: proved to be false or incorrect

DEEP STATE.Definition: organizations such as military, police, or political groups that are said to work secretly in order to protect particular interests and to rule a country without being elected

DISTRACT.Definition: to make someone stop giving their attention to something

EASE.Definition: the state of experiencing no difficulty, effort, pain, etc

FAKED.Definition: not real, but made to look or seem real

FANNING THE FLAMES.Definition: to make a dangerous or unpleasant mood or situation worse

FRANCHISE.Definition: a series of films that have the same or similar titles and are about the same characters

GIVEN THE LIGHT OF DAY.Definition: when something sees the light of day, it appears for the first time

GOODIES.Definition: people, especially in a film or story, who are good

INSTITUTION.Definition: a large and important organization, such as a university or bank

INTENTIONALLY.Definition: in a planned or intended way

LAUGHABLE.Definition: silly and not deserving to be seriously considered

LEGITIMISES.Definition: to make something legal or acceptable

MAINSTREAM.Definition: considered normal, and having or using ideas, beliefs, etc. that are accepted by most people

NICHE.Definition: interesting to, aimed at, or affecting only a small number of people

OVERPLAY.Definition: to make something seem more important than it really is

PILED UP.Definition: objects positioned one on top of another

PREHISTORIC.Definition: describing the period before there were written records

QUITE A STRETCH.Definition: if something is a stretch, usually means that it is not very believable or that something doesn't fit

RABBIT WARREN.Definition: a series of connecting underground passages and holes in which rabbits live, used figuratively to describe the fact that one link would lead to another

SEDUCTIVE.Definition: making you want to do, have, or believe something, because of seeming attractive

SERIAL.Definition: used to describe a person who repeatedly commits a similar crime or carries out a similar bad act, or the crime or act itself

SLIPPERY SLOPE.Definition: a bad situation or habit that, after it has started, is likely to get very much worse

SPREAD.Definition: to move from one place to another, or to cause something to move or be communicated

SUPPOSEDLY.Definition: used to show that you do not believe that something you have been told is true

SURFACED.Definition: if a feeling or information surfaces, it becomes known

TAMED.Definition: (especially of animals) not wild or dangerous, either naturally or because of training or long involvement with humans

TENUOUS.Definition: a tenuous connection, idea, or situation is weak and possibly does not exist

WACKIEST.Definition: most strange, unusual in a pleasing and exciting or silly way
